recipe.title: How to Make Shumai
recipe.intro: Shumai are small steamed dumplings from Japan. They are soft and very tasty.
recipe.ingredients: ground pork, onion, corn starch, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, salt, pepper, shumai wrappers, green peas
steps: **Cut** the onion into very small pieces and mix with corn starch.
**Put** the pork, onion, soy sauce, sesame oil, sugar, salt, and pepper in a bowl and mix well.
**Hold** one wrapper in your hand and put some meat in the middle.
**Close** the wrapper around the meat but leave the top open.
**Put** one green pea on top of each shumai.
**Steam** the shumai for about ten minutes until they are cooked. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I visited River Garden Kitchen last weekend. It was at South Bank in Brisbane. I sat in the garden area near the river. The view was so pretty. I could see the city and the water. I ordered shumai and they were very soft and hot. The garden had many flowers, and I saw some yellow and lavender ones. The staff were kind and the music was quiet. I felt very relaxed there.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Shumai? No, I do not know. What is it?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: It is a small steamed dumpling from Japan.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Oh, like dim sum? I like dim sum!

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Yes! Shumai is a kind of dim sum. It is very soft.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Pork and onion. And there is a green pea on top.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: That sounds cute. Is it hard to make?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: No, it is easy. You do not need an oven.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Really? How do you cook it?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: You steam it. It takes about ten minutes.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Nice! Can you make some for our next day off?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Sure! I will bring some to the share house.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Great! I cannot wait. Thank you!
